1040342773172523008.text: Our bill ensures that these increased revenues will be committed to  projects that restore the coast, protect our coastal communities from  hurricanes and other disaster and, ultimately, reduce our nation’s  outrageous disaster response costs.

1040342684513316870.text: La is battling the largest historical, ongoing and prospective loss of coastal wetlands and it’s a national crisis.  Diverting our energy $ away from efforts to improve our resiliency is a fundamentally flawed approach to addressing the maintenance backlog in national parks.

1040342258963361794.text: The bill was considered today in conjunction with the Restore Our Parks and Public Lands Act, which  proposed using Gulf offshore energy revenues to address the maintenance  backlog of the National Park Service and other agencies across the  country.

1040342093154197504.text: Our bill,   H.R. 6771 amends the Gulf of Mexico Energy Security Act 2006 (GOMESA) to bring Gulf offshore energy revenue sharing in line with levels that onshore  energy producing states enjoy – an effort long pursued by Louisiana’s  congressional delegation.

966022100887666690.text: Project efficiency is not limited to highways. The West Shore flood control project was in the STUDY phase for 42 years before proposed for construction.  And construction still hasn't started.

966021533419393024.text: The fact that we call the Mississippi River bridge that was built before I was born as "new" is the best indicator that something needs to change.

966021014491664384.text: There is no doubt we need more money to support infrastructure in the capital region but we can't keep spending money in the same system that got us to this point.

966020848405577730.text: Brand new four lane roads in areas that don't have traffic don't make sense when there isn't enough investment in the capital region - some of the worst traffic in the US.

966020037386625025.text: The current infrastructure prioritization system in place today is flawed. Project development needs to be metric based and objective.

966019580337500160.text: We don't have years of infrastructure investment to catch up on. We have decades.

943244678765449216.text: La wins in the bill: our flood and other disaster victims get the tax breaks we’ve fought for all year long, we preserved tax incentives uniquely critical for community development, historic preservation, economic reinvestment and higher education.

943244424682893312.text: Finally, this bill helps eliminate the strategic advantage that foreign companies hold over America’s small biz by providing competitive tax rates. It provides opportunities for Americans by creating jobs here in our country not overseas and helps to increase $ for our families.

936669194384564224.text: This is the way that government is supposed to work. #DRRA

936669157298458637.text: It truly captures and takes action on the frontline feedback and lessons learned from our August flood, recent hurricanes, and other events.

936669122796105728.text: This is one of the most significant disaster recovery and preparedness bills in decades. #DRRA

936669077808001024.text: We pushed hard for the H.R. 4460 provision that qualifies houses of worship and faith-based non-profits for FEMA assistance to repair, restore or replace when they are damaged.

936669031582617600.text: Without fail, some of the most reliable, generous agents of recovery are the many churches in the Capital Region.

936668940247486464.text: This policy will help to make the necessary changes to the interstate barrier and drainage to facilitate evacuations and road usage during floods. #DRRA

936668903736037378.text: Like I-12 in Baton Rouge and Livingston Parish.

936668833213018112.text: H.R. 4460 requires FEMA to collaborate with the Federal Highway Administration to develop policy on the design, construction and repair of evacuations routes…

936668793522278401.text: This will alleviate much of the headache that many Louisianans experienced during last year’s flood.

936668756188782592.text: The DRRA requires FEMA and other agencies work to implement a streamlined process whereby disaster victims can provide information one time to a federal agency rather than having to apply multiple times to multiple agencies for disaster assistance.

936668705802674177.text: Ultimately saving taxpayer dollars.  The bill also funds a “surge” of building inspectors to help address permitting and assessment activities that typically delay rebuilding and recovery.

936668646293860357.text: The DRRA establishes a new program where rebuilding and recovery efforts can include resilient construction to help prevent repetitive losses and to prepare for future disasters…

936668604329840640.text: The amendment also makes food banks eligible for FEMA repair assistance.

936668544393195520.text: T&I unanimously adopted our amendment requiring FEMA to more closely collaborate with food banks like the Greater Baton Rouge Area Food Bank, St. Vincent de Paul, and Long-term Recovery Groups like Rebuild Louisiana, Samaritan’s Purse, and others.

936654363040337921.text: It’s important to invest federal dollars in projects that will prevent these disasters from happening in the future.

936654324486365184.text: Like the Comite River Diversion Canal. #DRRA

936654294727700481.text: Our amendment also clarifies the flexibility to states and local governments to complete MUCH needed flood mitigation projects…

936654259407540224.text: For example, the DRRA will eliminate the very flawed “duplication of benefits” policy that prevents LA flood survivors from gaining Restore LA grants.

936654234149416960.text: Several of mine and Congressman Richmond’s policies were included in the bill…

936654165140496384.text: The DRRA represents an important move toward the federal government taking a more proactive approach to disaster preparation, relief and recovery which is something that I have advocated for a long time.

936654113173065728.text: Can better prepare for, respond to, recover from, and mitigate against floods, hurricanes and disasters of all kinds. #DRRA

936654087600386048.text: And It cuts through bureaucracies when disaster strikes so that families, individuals, small businesses, and state and local governments…

936654057225191425.text: This bill makes critical reforms to FEMA’s disaster response and recovery programs to provide on the ground help…

936654030369148930.text: Yesterday The Disaster Recovery Reform Act was unanimously approved by the Transportation and Infrastructure committee. #DRRA

910623077763096576.text: After 31 years, it’s time for common sense tax reform.  Learn more here: https://t.co/5qNRabecIY

910622910586515456.text: Tax cuts will allow hard-working Americans to keep their money in their pockets to save, invest, or spend it how THEY see fit…

910622846619176961.text: We want our nation to be competitive, but the code we have on the books now is crippling to our country’s businesses.

910622798963462144.text: America has the highest corporate tax rate in the WORLD.

910622764804997122.text: 2.  We have got to cut taxes across the board…

910622700414136322.text: And you shouldn’t have to spend your hard-earned money on filing your taxes.

910622659859402752.text: In fact, filing your taxes should be as easy as filling out a postcard.

910622604926603264.text: Americans need a simple and fair tax code, one that’s easy to understand.

910622523607470080.text: It’s actually 74,608 pages and 2.4 MILLION words long to be exact… It’s ridiculous.

910622462727122954.text: 1. The current tax code is incredibly complicated…

910622418804363265.text: There are many reasons we need tax reform, but here are a couple…

824658027403997184.text: Comite should have been completed decades ago, but now we actually have the opportunity to do it.

824657975742758912.text: … Few can afford the cost of raising their homes – I know our family couldn’t afford it.

824657884936015872.text: Completing it would also lower the region’s base flood elevation & eliminate need for many home/biz owners from having to raise their homes

824657616341237762.text: With these Hazard Mitigation Grant Program funds, the state just has to prioritize the goals of the Comite project and move forward.

824657564541521921.text: Through funds appropriated by Congress, Louisiana has more than $250 million in available flood and disaster prevention funds.

824657512909697027.text: The project could be completed in approximately two years – and the state has the federal funds available now to build it. @SteveRHardy

824657422593695744.text: While it will not solve all flood risk, Comite would benefit the most people in the shortest time…

824657357389062144.text: The Comite River Diversion Canal should be built to provide flood protection for area residents and improve our regional resiliency

823987738160615424.text: It's time to partner with the private sector and turn dirt instead of talking and "studying."

823987643033812993.text: In the decades it takes the Corps to study projects, homes & business flood, vulnerable communities disappear & taxpayers $ are wasted.

823987108427796480.text: Things like spending billions after disasters instead of millions on prevention beforehand make no sense. We need to work/spend smarter.

823987040383537152.text: We’re working to make La. a case study on how flood protection/water projects should be done instead of another story of govt failure.

823986871013359617.text: but we are committed to helping lead the trans-formative change.

823986818009989120.text: Untangling the decades of bureaucracy and culture of delay w/in the Corps, EPA and others takes time,

823986484311105536.text: Modernizing our country's  infrastructure starts with regulatory reform; You can’t do infrastructure without reg reform first.

823986268086353924.text: Excited to translate Trump's proposed Infrastructure Package into policy-particularly with bridges, flood protection and coastal restoration

823985532724269057.text: Shortening the time it takes Corps projects to be built will be a priority as we demand more efficiency from government

823985324380528641.text: Fighting to limit the scope & economic damages of regulations is one opportunity I’m looking forward to as Water Resources Chair.

822199996309262338.text: . @mattbailey But for a more recent look, check out CEI's 2016 "Ten  Thousand Commandments": https://t.co/930vh87H54

822199786778595330.text: . @mattbailey Lots of answers and lots of #'s out there. > 1.5 mil pgs in the Fed Reg across the last 2+ decades for starters...

822153409356857344.text: We can achieve real environmental benefits through efforts compatible with economic growth.

822153109334007809.text: We have to untangle our job creators from the costly burden of excessive regulations so they can prosper.

822152960532770816.text: PROVE IT will bring fairness, transparency and accountability to the federal regulatory system.

822152841070575616.text: but the over regulated public is still unfairly forced to pay for them.  We need to end this regulatory abuse.

822152752012951554.text: The costs of regulations almost always exceed the self-serving predictions agencies use when the rules are issued,

822152532977942528.text: The PROVE IT amendment requires federal agencies to regularly quantify and assess the regulations.

822152388052156416.text: Billions of dollars that our biz and manufacturers could use to boost wages and grow jobs are diverted to comply with the new regulations.

822151842268413953.text: Regulations are effectively a hidden tax.

822151744700502020.text: Last week the House voted to approve the Regulatory Accountability Act with my PROVE IT amendment attached.

822151640824381442.text: The top two most burdensome areas of regulation for small business were the federal tax code and Affordable Care Act. We can do better.

822151519667625985.text: Because of the high costs of complying with regulations, more than half of small businesses have held off on hiring new employees.

822151357331337216.text: According to the National Small Business Association, the average small-biz owner is spending at least $12k every year for regulations.

822151075688050688.text: This has a significant impact on Louisiana’s jobs and economy.

822150950156640257.text: Did you know that in Louisiana we have 74% more regulations than the rest of the country?

817087940245549056.text: It’s time to address the biggest challenges we face, from restoring the people’s voice to fixing healthcare.

817038557730787330.text: With a unified government, we will work together to buck the status quo and create real progress for the American people.

817038374829637633.text: The #REINSAct guarantees approval by the people's representatives for expensive rules and regulations coming out of the federal gov't.

817038193329655808.text: We are hitting the ground running to hold the executive branch accountable for expensive rules and regulations.

817037604763959298.text: This week, the House votes on the #REINSAct to curb unnecessary major regulations from unelected bureaucrats.

816756050347048965.text: We are ready to shake up Washington, D.C. from the top to bottom and get our country back on track.

816755706074370048.text: Passing bills this week to help our Vets, roll back over-regulation from the WH and put America on a better trajectory.

816755299558260736.text: Hitting the ground running at the start of the new Congress....

816755107287199745.text: We are focusing on the things people told us to focus on through the election: transparency and accountability.

816747726859812872.text: This is not the time to dismantle the House Ethics Panel. In fact, I think we need to be strengthening them.

804838025352060929.text: Flood waters didn’t recognize one socioeconomic class or one race, it flooded everybody; and the fed. govt. should treat everyone the same.

804837605162516480.text: Here we are 100 days after the flood event and FEMA is telling people they’ll get a trailer in January and February…this is ridiculous.

804837491236892672.text: Our recovery wasn’t by government, this was the community coming together and rescuing themselves.

804835915722059776.text: We can do better than this, and we're going to keep pressing, keep pushing and keep fighting until people get what they deserve out of govt.

804835794909331456.text: People want government to be responsive and help them. People want government to be efficient.

804835709085478913.text: The govt. is wasting money and taking months and spending 10x's to do what our communities could do at a fraction of the cost & time.

804835219270463488.text: Look no further than at what we're experiencing in south Louisiana today - being re-victimized by FEMA and the SBA in our recovery effort.

804835180204662785.text: It's not a surprise to me that people are frustrated with government.
